comment: Professor Giorgis is good. Average teacher that teaches from the online textbook. No issue with him at all. Just make sure you complete all your assignments and show up to class. If I didn't have to show up to class then I wouldn't but there are in class assignments.
Very sweet guy and cares about his students. if you ever have a question don't be afraid to reach out and email him. I'm not the best at math but he made it so easy and it became really fun!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Really enjoyed being in his class. The pace for his class was easy for me to follow. Go to class, participate in the class questions, and do your homework (even accepts it late!). Attendance matters, does iClicker. Overall, he's a good guy and it was a good class.

I've never been particularly strong in math, but he explained the material in a way that was easy to understand. I never scored lower than a B on any test and even earned a 100 at one point. If you attend class regularly, take good notes, and ask questions when you need to, you'll do just fine.

He's fine- the Alexx is very helpful and will teach you a lot. Beware-attendance is taken by an app you have to click on and you have to be close to the class. then in class he does pop questions that are graded and you can only do them if your in class. Other than that just do the homework and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: The most gorgeous

He was truly amazing. He stayed after class every single day and would not leave until everyone's questions were answered. JUST GO TO CLASS. He does every single step in class, I barely had to work outside of class. Using excel can be difficult, but I learned so much. He is very caring, and never complains when someone needs help.

He is very nice and a good teacher. Some tests have things that he does not teach in class but are on ALEKS. Kinda difficult but he is helpful and will talk to you about how to get your grade up if needed. Overall very sweet and caring and wants you to pass his class.

Professor Giorgis is very sweet and genuinely cares about his students. I really enjoyed taking his class. However, workload on ALEKS is seemingly very different from what we are taught in class. Often times the test would be on different material than we were taught.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: He seriously cares about all of his students so much and makes sure to answer all questions you have. I would recommend going to his office hours for more help. The class itself is confusing and intimidating but you'll get the hang of it. The videos are great. The lecture manual is confusing and its a lot of coursework. Go to class and reach out!

Class wasn't bad, i felt like he made it more difficult. Very nitpicky with grading and instructions for assignments were almost always confusing. Class was basically one big project and you work on a bit of it each week. Easy quizzes (straight from notes). No tests just 1 weekly assignment and 1 weekly quiz. Wouldnt take again & he's not the nice.

His lectures are really easy to understand in my opinion. He explains why we do certain things a certain way, and I really enjoy that. He doesn't assign that much work and it's all reasonable. Would take again!

Very nice professor, he always tried to simplify topics during lectures. Lectures were mainly notetaking, but he provided guided notes. Know that attendance is a part of your grade. Most work was done on ALEKS, but were easy enough, just do them early. There were online quizzes about every week, but you get two chances for them. Would take again.

Giorgis's class is infuriating! Skip a day, and you're lost. Tutors are clueless because he teaches different from the other teachers! His teaching style is a disaster. Better live in his office hours to figure things out. Frustrating, but if you want to survive, you gotta adapt. WOULD NOT TAKE!!!

I took him for data 1501 (I don't know why its not an option) but he was good his pace was very fast and he did not explain everything very well. The class itself is not very hard but he just doesnt explain anything and goes very fast. If you ask him for help hes very helpful and will let more slide if you show up.

He is a mediocre teacher. He posts the guided notes on D2L but fills them out in class. He takes attendance, but it is not graded attendance. If you have been showing up and participating and then ask for help/xtra credit, he is more likely to help you out. He's nice just dull and the tests are hard. I wouldn't recommend him but his class is doable

I loved his class. I hate math but somehow managed to get an A+ with him. He goes a little fast BUT gives out guided notes and is willing to stop and explain everything at any given time. He genuinely cares about his students and assigns homework which is harder than the tests, so you are prepared and do well on them. Also allows cheat sheets,10/10

Prof Giorgis was a great prof. If you attend lectures and pay attention to notes you should pass easily. There is HW on ALEKS, but it's not too much. Every time I emailed him outside of class he responded quickly. Small quizzes don't require Lockdown Browser + Camera, but the Unit Tests and Gen Ed Exam do. I say TAKE HIM it's an easy A!

Despite what others say I had such a positive experience with him. I took him twice actually and he took his time to remember me and he was really nice. He gives out a lot of homework but i never had to study as long as i did that. He pushed deadlines and was extremely understanding. I would encourage anyone who is not the best at math to take him.

I was nervous about this class, but this has been so amazing. The prof is very understanding and caring. He extends deadlines frequently and is quite lenient. This class was extremely easy, and I would take it again. There is weekly homework which takes about 1-2 hours, but they are very simple, and you often have over a week to complete each one.

Don't believe the old bad reviews. They are from COVID era when many students were mad about online work & faculty were scrambling to figure things out. He is awesome! There is a lot of homework but it's nothing crazy. Professor Giorgis is very honest about what he knows & doesn't know which we appreciate. Very good at explaining things!

some of these reviews are very off putting because from my experience he was an excellent teacher and explained the material very well. If I ever had a problem I would come up to him and he would help me in every way that he could.
 there definitely was a lot of homework on ALEKS but as long as you stayed on top of it, it was a great class!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: he would teach us one way, then ALEKS would teach us another way, and then we would have to solve questions on tests in a way we never learned. He sucked at teaching.

Hard class. He would help if you asked but even then it was never a good explanation. The WiFi went out in my apartment building(the entire building) during the first test so none of my answers saved and I received a 0. He told me there was nothing he could do about it and to take the next test on campus on their computers.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Giorgis was top 2 worst teachers in my opinion. He would teach you something one way and then give you a test that made you do a problem in a way you've never learn. I was told by him "as a college student I should be able to do it a different way than taught" Im not the best at math, but his teaching and testing execution were confusing and hard.
